intro: Matthiola pseudoxyceras, commonly known as the narrow-leaved stock, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, featuring slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, fragrant, and usually pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. Matthiola pseudoxyceras is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and its ability to attract pollinators.
